articles.title: Liver condition suffered by non-drinkers can lead to cardiovascular diseases - The Straits Times
articles.description:
It is estimated that up to 40 per cent of the population in South-east Asian countries, including Singapore, have non-alcoholic fatty liver disease.
. Read more at straitstimes.com.
articles.content:
SINGAPORE - The patients drink little to no alcohol and yet end up with a condition - called non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) - that can lead to serious cardiovascular complications.
